(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

straight_heater_doped_strip#

gdsfactory.components.straight_heater_doped_strip(length=320.0, nsections=3, cross_section=functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, add_pins=functools.partial(<function add_pins_siepic>, pin_length=0.002), add_bbox=<function add_bbox_siepic>, cladding_layers=('DEVREC', ), cladding_offsets=(0, ), sections=(Section(width=0.2, offset=0, layer='SLAB90', port_names=(None, None), port_types=('optical', 'optical'), name='slab', hidden=False), )), *, cross_section_heater=<cyfunction strip_heater_doped>, via_stack=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((1, 0), (24, 0), (41, 0)), vias=(None, None, functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIAC'))), via_stack_metal=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((41, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), via_stack_metal_size=(10.0, 10.0), via_stack_size=(10.0, 10.0), taper=<function taper_cross_section>, with_taper1=True, with_taper2=True, heater_width=2.0, heater_gap=0.8, via_stack_gap=0.0, width=0.5, xoffset_tip1=0.2, xoffset_tip2=0.4, **kwargs)#

Returns a doped thermal phase shifter.

dimensions from https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.27.010456

Parameters

  • length (float) – of the waveguide in um.

  • nsections (int) – between via_stacks.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for the input/output ports.

  • cross_section_heater (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for the heater.

  • via_stack (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – optional function to connect the heater strip.

  • via_stack_metal (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – function to connect the metal area.

  • via_stack_metal_size (Tuple[float, float]) – x, y size in um.

  • via_stack_size (Tuple[float, float]) – x, y size in um.

  • taper (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – optional taper spec.

  • heater_width (float) – in um.

  • heater_gap (float) – in um.

  • via_stack_gap (float) – from edge of via_stack to waveguide.

  • width (float) – waveguide width on the ridge.

  • xoffset_tip1 (float) – distance in um from input taper to via_stack.

  • xoffset_tip2 (float) – distance in um from output taper to via_stack.

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

  • with_taper1 (bool) –

  • with_taper2 (bool) –

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

                      length
|<--------------------------------------------->|
|              length_section                   |
|    <--------------------------->              |
|  length_via_stack                               |
|    <------->                             taper|
|    __________                   _________     |
|   |          |                  |        |    |
|   | via_stack|__________________|        |    |
|   |  size    |  heater width    |        |    |
|  /|__________|__________________|________|\   |
| / |             heater_gap               | \  |
|/  |______________________________________|  \ |
 \  |_______________width__________________|  /
  \ |                                      | /
   \|_____________heater_gap______________ |/
    |        |                    |        |
    |        |____heater_width____|        |
    |        |                    |        |
    |________|                    |________|

taper         cross_section_heater



                           |<------width------>|
                            ____________________ heater_gap             slab_gap
     top_via_stack         |                   |<---------->| bot_via_stack   <-->
 ___ ______________________|                   |___________________________|___
|   |            |               undoped Si                 |              |   |
|   |layer_heater|               intrinsic region           |layer_heater  |   |
|___|____________|__________________________________________|______________|___|
                                                             <------------>
                                                              heater_width
<------------------------------------------------------------------------------>
                               slab_width

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.straight_heater_doped_strip(length=320.0, nsections=3, via_stack_metal_size=[10.0, 10.0], via_stack_size=[10.0, 10.0], with_taper1=True, with_taper2=True, heater_width=2.0, heater_gap=0.8, via_stack_gap=0.0, width=0.5, xoffset_tip1=0.2, xoffset_tip2=0.4)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

straight_heater_meander#

gdsfactory.components.straight_heater_meander(length=300.0, spacing=2.0, cross_section='strip', heater_width=2.5, extension_length=15.0, layer_heater='HEATER', radius=5.0, via_stack=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((47, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), port_orientation1=180, port_orientation2=0, heater_taper_length=10.0, straight_widths=(0.8, 0.9, 0.8), taper_length=10)[source]#

Returns a meander based heater.

based on SungWon Chung, Makoto Nakai, and Hossein Hashemi, Low-power thermo-optic silicon modulator for large-scale photonic integrated systems Opt. Express 27, 13430-13459 (2019) https://www.osapublishing.org/oe/abstract.cfm?URI=oe-27-9-13430

FIXME: only works for 3 rows.

Parameters

  • length (float) – total length of the optical path.

  • spacing (float) – waveguide spacing (center to center).

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[..., CrossSection], CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for waveguide.

  • heater_width (float) – for heater.

  • extension_length (float) – of input and output optical ports.

  • layer_heater (Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str, None]) – for top heater, if None, it does not add a heater.

  • radius (float) – for the meander bends.

  • via_stack (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – for the heater to via_stack metal.

  • port_orientation1 (int) – in degrees.

  • port_orientation2 (int) – in degrees.

  • heater_taper_length (Optional[float]) – minimizes current concentrations from heater to via_stack.

  • straight_width – width of the straight section.

  • taper_length (float) – from the cross_section.

  • straight_widths (Tuple[float, ...]) –

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.straight_heater_meander(length=300.0, spacing=2.0, cross_section='strip', heater_width=2.5, extension_length=15.0, layer_heater='HEATER', radius=5.0, port_orientation1=180, port_orientation2=0, heater_taper_length=10.0, straight_widths=[0.8, 0.9, 0.8], taper_length=10)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

straight_heater_metal#

gdsfactory.components.straight_heater_metal(length=320.0, length_undercut_spacing=6.0, length_undercut=30.0, length_straight_input=15.0, heater_width=2.5, cross_section_heater='heater_metal', cross_section_waveguide_heater='strip_heater_metal', cross_section_heater_undercut='strip_heater_metal_undercut', *, with_undercut=False, via_stack=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((47, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), port_orientation1=180, port_orientation2=0, heater_taper_length=5.0, ohms_per_square=None, cross_section=None, **kwargs)#

Returns a thermal phase shifter.

dimensions from https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.27.010456

Parameters

  • length (float) – of the waveguide.

  • length_undercut_spacing (float) – from undercut regions.

  • length_undercut (float) – length of each undercut section.

  • length_straight_input (float) – from input port to where trenches start.

  • heater_width (float) – in um.

  • cross_section_heater (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections. heater metal only.

  • cross_section_waveguide_heater (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections.

  • cross_section_heater_undercut (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections with undercut.

  • with_undercut (bool) – isolation trenches for higher efficiency.

  • via_stack (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – via stack.

  • port_orientation1 (int) – left via stack port orientation.

  • port_orientation2 (int) – right via stack port orientation.

  • heater_taper_length (Optional[float]) – minimizes current concentrations from heater to via_stack.

  • ohms_per_square (Optional[float]) – to calculate resistance.

  • cross_section (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]]) – for waveguide ports.

  • kwargs – cross_section common settings.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.straight_heater_metal(length=320.0, length_undercut_spacing=6.0, length_undercut=30.0, length_straight_input=15.0, heater_width=2.5, cross_section_heater='heater_metal', cross_section_waveguide_heater='strip_heater_metal', cross_section_heater_undercut='strip_heater_metal_undercut', with_undercut=False, port_orientation1=180, port_orientation2=0, heater_taper_length=5.0)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

dimensions from https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.27.010456

  • length (float) – of the waveguide.

  • length_undercut_spacing (float) – from undercut regions.

  • length_undercut (float) – length of each undercut section.

  • length_straight_input (float) – from input port to where trenches start.

  • heater_width (float) – in um.

  • cross_section_heater (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections. heater metal only.

  • cross_section_waveguide_heater (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections.

  • cross_section_heater_undercut (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for heated sections with undercut.

  • with_undercut (bool) – isolation trenches for higher efficiency.

  • port_orientation1 (int) – left via stack port orientation.

  • port_orientation2 (int) – right via stack port orientation.

  • heater_taper_length (Optional[float]) – minimizes current concentrations from heater to via_stack.

  • ohms_per_square (Optional[float]) – to calculate resistance.

straight_pin#

gdsfactory.components.straight_pin(length=500.0, cross_section=<cyfunction pin>, via_stack=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((3, 0), (41, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIAC'), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), via_stack_width=10.0, via_stack_spacing=2, taper=<function taper_strip_to_ridge>, **kwargs)[source]#

Returns straight PIN waveguide with via_stacks.

https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.26.029983

500um length for PI phase shift https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8268112

to go beyond 2PI, you will need at least 1mm https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8853396/

Parameters

  • length (float) – of the waveguide.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[..., CrossSection], CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for the waveguide.

  • via_stack (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – for the via_stacks.

  • via_stack_width (float) – width of the via_stack.

  • via_stack_spacing (float) – spacing between via_stacks.

  • taper (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – optional taper.

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

straight_pin_slot#

gdsfactory.components.straight_pin_slot(length=500.0, cross_section=<cyfunction pin>, via_stack=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((41, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), via_stack_width=10.0, via_stack_slab=functools.partial(<function via_stack_slot>, layers=('M1', ), via=functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIAC')), via_stack_slab_top=None, via_stack_slab_bot=None, via_stack_slab_width=None, via_stack_spacing=3.0, via_stack_slab_spacing=2.0, taper=<function taper_strip_to_ridge>, **kwargs)[source]#

Returns a PIN straight waveguide with slotted via.

https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.26.029983

500um length for PI phase shift https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8268112

to go beyond 2PI, you will need at least 1mm https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8853396/

Parameters

  • length (float) – of the waveguide.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[..., CrossSection], CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – for the waveguide.

  • via_stack (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – for via_stacking the metal.

  • via_stack_width (float) – in um.

  • via_stack_slab (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – function for the component via_stacking the slab.

  • via_stack_slab_top (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – Optional, defaults to via_stack_slab.

  • via_stack_slab_bot (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – Optional, defaults to via_stack_slab.

  • via_stack_slab_width (Optional[float]) – defaults to via_stack_width.

  • via_stack_spacing (float) – spacing between via_stacks.

  • via_stack_slab_spacing (float) – spacing between via_stacks slabs.

  • taper (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None]) – optional taper.

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

straight_rib#

gdsfactory.components.straight_rib(length=10.0, npoints=2, with_bbox=True, *, cross_section=functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, add_pins=functools.partial(<function add_pins_siepic>, pin_length=0.002), add_bbox=<function add_bbox_siepic>, cladding_layers=('DEVREC',), cladding_offsets=(0,), bbox_layers=['SLAB90'], bbox_offsets=[3]), **kwargs)#

Returns a Straight waveguide.

Parameters

  • length (float) – straight length (um).

  • npoints (int) – number of points.

  • with_bbox (bool) – box in bbox_layers and bbox_offsets to avoid DRC sharp edges.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – specification (CrossSection, string, CrossSectionFactory dict).

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

o1 -------------- o2
        length

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.straight_rib(length=10.0, npoints=2, with_bbox=True)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

straight_rib_tapered#

gdsfactory.components.straight_rib_tapered(*, component=functools.partial(<function straight>, cross_section=functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, add_pins=functools.partial(<function add_pins_siepic>, pin_length=0.002), add_bbox=<function add_bbox_siepic>, cladding_layers=('DEVREC',), cladding_offsets=(0,), bbox_layers=['SLAB90'], bbox_offsets=[3])), port_names=None, length=5.0, extension=<function taper_strip_to_ridge>, port1='o2', port2='o1', port_type='optical', centered=False, cross_section=None, extension_port_names=None, **kwargs)#

Returns a new component with some ports extended.

You can define extension Spec defaults to port cross_section of each port to extend.

Parameters

  • component (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – component to extend ports.

  • port_names (Optional[Tuple[str, ...]]) – list of ports names to extend, if None it extends all ports.

  • length (float) – extension length.

  • extension (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – function to extend ports (defaults to a straight).

  • port1 (Optional[str]) – extension input port name.

  • port2 (Optional[str]) – extension output port name.

  • port_type (str) – type of the ports to extend.

  • centered (bool) – if True centers rectangle at (0, 0).

  • cross_section (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]]) – extension cross_section, defaults to port cross_section if port has no cross_section it creates one using width and layer.

  • extension_port_names (Optional[List[str]]) – extension port names add to the new component.

Keyword Arguments

  • layer – port GDS layer.

  • prefix – port name prefix.

  • orientation – in degrees.

  • width – port width.

  • layers_excluded – List of layers to exclude.

  • port_type – optical, electrical, ….

  • clockwise – if True, sort ports clockwise, False: counter-clockwise.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.straight_rib_tapered(length=5.0, port1='o2', port2='o1', port_type='optical', centered=False)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

switch_tree#

gdsfactory.components.switch_tree(*, coupler=functools.partial(<function mzi>, combiner=<function mmi2x2>, port_e1_combiner='o3', port_e0_combiner='o4', delta_length=0, straight_x_top=functools.partial(<function straight_heater_metal_undercut>, with_undercut=False), length_x=None), noutputs=4, spacing=(500, 100), bend_s=<function bend_s>, bend_s_xsize=None, cross_section='strip')#

Tree of power splitters.

Parameters

  • coupler (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – coupler factory.

  • noutputs (int) – number of outputs.

  • spacing (Tuple[float, float]) – x, y spacing between couplers.

  • bend_s (Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – Sbend function for termination.

  • bend_s_xsize (Optional[float]) – xsize for the sbend.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – cross_section.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

     __|
  __|  |__
_|  |__
 |__        dy

  dx

taper#

gdsfactory.components.taper(length=10.0, width1=0.5, width2=None, port=None, with_bbox=True, with_two_ports=True, cross_section='strip', **kwargs)[source]#

Linear taper.

Deprecated, use gf.components.taper_cross_section instead

Parameters

  • length (float) – taper length.

  • width1 (float) – width of the west port.

  • width2 (Optional[float]) – width of the east port.

  • port (Optional[Port]) – can taper from a port instead of defining width1.

  • with_bbox (bool) – box in bbox_layers and bbox_offsets to avoid DRC sharp edges.

  • with_two_ports (bool) – includes a second port. False for terminator and edge coupler fiber interface.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[..., CrossSection], CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – specification (CrossSection, string, CrossSectionFactory dict).

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.taper(length=10.0, width1=0.5, with_bbox=True, with_two_ports=True, cross_section='strip')
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

taper2#

Linear taper.

Deprecated, use gf.components.taper_cross_section instead

Parameters

  • length (float) – taper length.

  • width1 (float) – width of the west port.

  • width2 (Optional[float]) – width of the east port.

  • port (Optional[gdsfactory.port.Port]) – can taper from a port instead of defining width1.

  • with_bbox (bool) – box in bbox_layers and bbox_offsets to avoid DRC sharp edges.

  • with_two_ports (bool) – includes a second port. False for terminator and edge coupler fiber interface.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – specification (CrossSection, string, CrossSectionFactory dict).

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

taper_cross_section_linear#

gdsfactory.components.taper_cross_section_linear(cross_section1=functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, add_pins=functools.partial(<function add_pins_siepic>, pin_length=0.002), add_bbox=<function add_bbox_siepic>, cladding_layers=('DEVREC', ), cladding_offsets=(0, ), sections=(Section(width=0.2, offset=0, layer='SLAB90', port_names=(None, None), port_types=('optical', 'optical'), name='slab', hidden=False), )), cross_section2=functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, add_pins=functools.partial(<function add_pins_siepic>, pin_length=0.002), add_bbox=<function add_bbox_siepic>, cladding_layers=('DEVREC', ), cladding_offsets=(0, ), sections=(Section(width=6.0, offset=0, layer='SLAB90', port_names=(None, None), port_types=('optical', 'optical'), name='slab', hidden=False), )), length=10, *, npoints=2, linear=True, width_type='sine', **kwargs)#

Returns taper transition between cross_section1 and cross_section2.

Parameters

  • cross_section1 (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – start cross_section factory.

  • cross_section2 (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – end cross_section factory.

  • length (float) – transition length.

  • npoints (int) – number of points.

  • linear (bool) – shape of the transition, sine when False.

  • width_type (str) – shape of the transition ONLY IF linear is False

  • kwargs – cross_section settings for section2.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

                    _____________________
                   /
           _______/______________________
                 /
cross_section1  |        cross_section2
           ______\_______________________
                  \
                   \_____________________

text_freetype#

gdsfactory.components.text_freetype(text='abcd', size=10, justify='left', layer='WG', font='DEPLOF')[source]#

Returns text Component.

Parameters

  • text (str) – string.

  • size (int) – in um.

  • position – x, y position.

  • justify (str) – left, right, center.

  • layer (Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str, None]) – for the text.

  • font (str) – Font face to use. Default DEPLOF does not require additional libraries, otherwise freetype load fonts. You can choose font by name (e.g. “Times New Roman”), or by file OTF or TTF filepath.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

text_rectangular#

gdsfactory.components.text_rectangular(text='abcd', size=10.0, position=(0.0, 0.0), justify='left', layer='WG', font=<functools._lru_cache_wrapper object>)[source]#

Pixel based font, guaranteed to be manhattan, without acute angles.

Parameters

  • text (str) – string.

  • size (float) – pixel size.

  • position (Tuple[float, float]) – coordinate.

  • justify (str) – left, right or center.

  • layer (Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str, None]) – for text.

  • font (Callable) – function that returns dictionary of characters.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.text_rectangular(text='abcd', size=10.0, position=[0.0, 0.0], justify='left', layer='WG')
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

text_rectangular_multi_layer#

gdsfactory.components.text_rectangular_multi_layer(text='abcd', layers=('WG', 'M1', 'M2', 'M3'), text_factory=<function text_rectangular>, **kwargs)[source]#

Returns rectangular text in different layers.

Parameters

  • text (str) – string of text

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None], ...]]) – list of layers to replicate the text

  • text_factory (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – function to create the text Components

Keyword Arguments

  • size – pixel size

  • position – coordinate

  • justify – left, right or center

  • font – function that returns dictionary of characters

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.text_rectangular_multi_layer(text='abcd', layers=['WG', 'M1', 'M2', 'M3'])
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

triangle#

gdsfactory.components.triangle(x=10, xtop=0, y=20, ybot=0, layer='WG')[source]#

Return triangle.

Parameters

  • x (float) – base xsize.

  • xtop (float) – top xsize.

  • y (float) – ysize.

  • ybot (float) – bottom ysize.

  • layer (Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str, None]) – layer.

  |  \
  |   \

  |     \
  |      \

      x

via#

gdsfactory.components.via(size=(0.7, 0.7), spacing=(2.0, 2.0), enclosure=1.0, layer='VIAC', bbox_layers=None, bbox_offset=0)[source]#

Rectangular via.

Defaults to a square via.

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) – in x, y direction.

  • spacing (Tuple[float, float]) – pitch_x, pitch_y.

  • enclosure (float) – inclusion of via.

  • layer (Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str, None]) – via layer.

  • bbox_layers (Optional[Tuple[Tuple[int, int], ...]]) – layers for the bounding box.

  • bbox_offset (float) – in um.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

enclosure
_________________________________________
|<--->                                  |
|                      size[0]          |
|                      <----->          |
|      ______          ______           |
|     |      |        |      |          |
|     |      |        |      |  size[1] |
|     |______|        |______|          |
|      <------------->                  |
|         spacing[0]                    |
|_______________________________________|
Return type

Component

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) –

  • spacing (Tuple[float, float]) –

  • enclosure (float) –

  • layer (Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str]]) –

  • bbox_layers (Optional[Tuple[Tuple[int, int], ...]]) –

  • bbox_offset (float) – 

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via(size=[0.7, 0.7], spacing=[2.0, 2.0], enclosure=1.0, layer='VIAC', bbox_offset=0)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

via_corner#

gdsfactory.components.via_corner(cross_section=((functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, layer='M2', width=10.0, port_names=('e1', 'e2'), port_types=('electrical', 'electrical'), radius=None), (0, 180)), (functools.partial(<cyfunction cross_section>, layer='M3', width=10.0, port_names=('e1', 'e2'), port_types=('electrical', 'electrical'), radius=None), (90, 270))), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), ), layers_labels=('m2', 'm3'), **kwargs)[source]#

Returns Corner via.

Use in place of wire_corner to route between two layers.

Parameters

  • cross_section (List[Tuple[Union[str, Callable[..., CrossSection], CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]], Tuple[int, ...]]]) – list of cross_section, orientation pairs.

  • vias (Tuple[Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any]]]) – vias to use to fill the rectangles.

  • layers_labels (Tuple[str, ...]) – Labels to use for each layer.

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via_corner(cross_section=[[{'function': 'cross_section', 'settings': {'layer': 'M2', 'width': 10.0, 'port_names': ['e1', 'e2'], 'port_types': ['electrical', 'electrical'], 'radius': None}}, [0, 180]], [{'function': 'cross_section', 'settings': {'layer': 'M3', 'width': 10.0, 'port_names': ['e1', 'e2'], 'port_types': ['electrical', 'electrical'], 'radius': None}}, [90, 270]]], layers_labels=['m2', 'm3'])
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

via_cutback#

gdsfactory.components.via_cutback(num_vias=100.0, wire_width=10.0, via_width=5.0, via_spacing=40.0, min_pad_spacing=0.0, pad=functools.partial(<function via_stack>, layers=((47, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2'))), pad_size=(150, 150), layer1='HEATER', layer2='M1', via_layer='VIAC', wire_pad_inclusion=12.0)[source]#

Via cutback to extract via resistance.

based on phidl.geometry

Parameters

  • num_vias (float) – total requested vias needs to be even.

  • wire_width (float) – width of wire.

  • via_width (float) – width of via.

  • via_spacing (float) – via_spacing.

  • pad_size (Tuple[float, float]) – (width, height).

  • min_pad_spacing. –

  • pad_layer. –

  • layer1 (Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None]) – top wiring.

  • layer2 (Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None]) – bottom wiring.

  • via_layer (Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None]) – via.

  • wire_pad_inclusion (float) – in um.

  • min_pad_spacing (float) –

  • pad (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]) –

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via_cutback(num_vias=100.0, wire_width=10.0, via_width=5.0, via_spacing=40.0, min_pad_spacing=0.0, pad_size=[150, 150], layer1='HEATER', layer2='M1', via_layer='VIAC', wire_pad_inclusion=12.0)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

via_stack#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack(size=(11.0, 11.0), layers=('M1', 'M2', 'M3'), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2')), layer_port=None)[source]#

Rectangular via array stack.

You can use it to connect different metal layers or metals to silicon. You can use the naming convention via_stack_layerSource_layerDestination contains 4 ports (e1, e2, e3, e4)

also know as Via array http://www.vlsi-expert.com/2017/12/vias.html

spacing = via.info[‘spacing’] enclosure = via.info[‘enclosure’]

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) – of the layers.

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None], ...]]) – layers on which to draw rectangles.

  • vias (Optional[Tuple[Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None], ...]]) – vias to use to fill the rectangles.

  • layer_port (Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int], None]) – if None assumes port is on the last layer.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via_stack(size=[11.0, 11.0], layers=['M1', 'M2', 'M3'])
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

via_stack_heater_m3#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack_heater_m3(size=(11.0, 11.0), *, layers=((47, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2')), layer_port=None)#

Rectangular via array stack.

You can use it to connect different metal layers or metals to silicon. You can use the naming convention via_stack_layerSource_layerDestination contains 4 ports (e1, e2, e3, e4)

also know as Via array http://www.vlsi-expert.com/2017/12/vias.html

spacing = via.info[‘spacing’] enclosure = via.info[‘enclosure’]

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) – of the layers.

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int]], ...]]) – layers on which to draw rectangles.

  • vias (Optional[Tuple[Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]], ...]]) – vias to use to fill the rectangles.

  • layer_port (Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str]]) – if None assumes port is on the last layer.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via_stack_heater_m3(size=[11.0, 11.0], layers=[[47, 0], [45, 0], [49, 0]])
c.plot()

via_stack_slab_m3#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack_slab_m3(size=(11.0, 11.0), *, layers=((3, 0), (41, 0), (45, 0), (49, 0)), vias=(functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIAC'), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA2')), layer_port=None)#

You can use it to connect different metal layers or metals to silicon. You can use the naming convention via_stack_layerSource_layerDestination contains 4 ports (e1, e2, e3, e4)

also know as Via array http://www.vlsi-expert.com/2017/12/vias.html

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int]], ...]]) – layers on which to draw rectangles.

  • vias (Optional[Tuple[Optional[Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]], ...]]) – vias to use to fill the rectangles.

  • layer_port (Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str]]) – if None assumes port is on the last layer.

via_stack_slot#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack_slot(size=(11.0, 11.0), layers=('M1', 'M2'), layer_offsets=(0, 1.0), layer_offsetsx=None, layer_offsetsy=None, layer_port=None, via=functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), enclosure=1.0, ysize=0.5, yspacing=2.0)[source]#

Rectangular via_stack with slotted via in X direction.

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) – of the layers.

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None], ...]]) – layers on which to draw rectangles.

  • layer_offsets (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) – cladding_offset for each layer.

  • layer_offsetsx (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) – optional xoffset for layers, defaults to layer_offsets.

  • layer_offsetsx – optional yoffset for layers, defaults to layer_offsets.

  • layer_port (Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int], None]) – if None assumes port is on the last layer.

  • via (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – via to use to fill the rectangles.

  • enclosure (float) – of the via by rectangle.

  • ysize (float) – via height in y.

  • yspacing (float) – via spacing pitch in y.

  • layer_offsetsy (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) –

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

 __________________________________________
|                |                        |
|                | layer_offsetsy[1]      |
|  ______________|______________________  |
|  |<--->                              |<>|
|  |enclosure                          | layer_offsetsx[1]
|  |      ______________________       |  |
|  |     |                      |      |  |
|  |     |     via              | ysize|  |
|  |     |______________________|      |  |
|  |  |                                |  |
|  |  | yspacing                size[1]|  |
|  |  |                                |  |
|  |  |   ______________________       |  |
|  |  |  |                      |      |  |
|  |  |  |     via              | ysize|  |
|  |  |  |______________________|      |  |
|  |                                   |  |
|  |                                   |  |
|  |___________________________________|  |
|                  size[0]                |
|                                         |
|_________________________________________|
Return type

Component

via_stack_slot_m1_m2#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack_slot_m1_m2(size=(11.0, 11.0), *, layers=('M1', 'M2'), layer_offsets=(0, 1.0), layer_offsetsx=None, layer_offsetsy=None, layer_port=None, via=functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIA1', enclosure=2), enclosure=1.0, ysize=0.5, yspacing=2.0)#

Rectangular via_stack with slotted via in X direction.

Parameters

  • size (Tuple[float, float]) – of the layers.

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int]], ...]]) – layers on which to draw rectangles.

  • layer_offsets (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) – cladding_offset for each layer.

  • layer_offsetsx (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) – optional xoffset for layers, defaults to layer_offsets.

  • layer_offsetsx – optional yoffset for layers, defaults to layer_offsets.

  • layer_port (Optional[Union[Tuple[int, int], int, str]]) – if None assumes port is on the last layer.

  • via (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.component.Component], gdsfactory.component.Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – via to use to fill the rectangles.

  • enclosure (float) – of the via by rectangle.

  • ysize (float) – via height in y.

  • yspacing (float) – via spacing pitch in y.

via_stack_with_offset#

gdsfactory.components.via_stack_with_offset(layers=('PPP', 'M1'), sizes=((10, 10), (10, 10)), vias=(None, functools.partial(<function via>, layer='VIAC')), offsets=None, port_orientation=180)[source]#

Rectangular layer transition with offset between layers.

Parameters

  • layers (Optional[Tuple[Union[Tuple[int, int], str, int, None], ...]]) – for each via.

  • vias (Tuple[Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any], None], ...]) – factory for via or None for no via.

  • sizes (Tuple[Tuple[float, float], ...]) – for each via.

  • offsets (Optional[Tuple[float, ...]]) – for next layer.

  • port_orientation (float) – 180: W0, 0: E0, 90: N0, 270: S0.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.via_stack_with_offset(layers=['PPP', 'M1'], sizes=[[10, 10], [10, 10]], port_orientation=180)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

viac#

Defaults to a square via.

  • spacing (Tuple[float, float]) – pitch_x, pitch_y.

|                      size[0]          |

|      <------------->                  |
|         spacing[0]                    |
|_______________________________________|

wafer#

gdsfactory.components.wafer(reticle='die', cols=(2, 6, 6, 8, 8, 6, 6, 2), xspacing=None, yspacing=None)[source]#

Returns complete wafer. Useful for mask aligner steps.

Parameters

  • reticle (Union[str, Callable[..., Component], Component, Dict[str, Any]]) – spec for each wafer reticle.

  • cols (Tuple[int, ...]) – how many columns per row.

  • xspacing (Optional[float]) – optional spacing, defaults to reticle.xsize.

  • yspacing (Optional[float]) – optional spacing, defaults to reticle.ysize.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.wafer(reticle='die', cols=[2, 6, 6, 8, 8, 6, 6, 2])
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

wire_sbend#

gdsfactory.components.wire_sbend(dx=20.0, dy=10.0, **kwargs)[source]#

Sbend corner with manhattan wires.

Parameters

  • dx (float) – xsize.

  • dy (float) – ysize.

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

Return type

Component

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.wire_sbend(dx=20.0, dy=10.0)
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)

wire_straight#

gdsfactory.components.wire_straight(length=10.0, npoints=2, with_bbox=True, *, cross_section='metal3', **kwargs)#

Returns a Straight waveguide.

Parameters

  • length (float) – straight length (um).

  • npoints (int) – number of points.

  • with_bbox (bool) – box in bbox_layers and bbox_offsets to avoid DRC sharp edges.

  • cross_section (Union[str, Callable[[...], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection], gdsfactory.cross_section.CrossSection, Dict[str, Any]]) – specification (CrossSection, string, CrossSectionFactory dict).

  • kwargs – cross_section settings.

Return type

gdsfactory.component.Component

o1 -------------- o2
        length

import gdsfactory as gf

c = gf.components.wire_straight(length=10.0, npoints=2, with_bbox=True, cross_section='metal3')
c.plot()

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)
